== Understand ==
Chalatenango is a few kilometers at the north of Suchitlan Lake
Its name comes from Nahuatl: chal, shal (sand); at, (water); tenango (valley)
It was created at pre-Columbian period by Lenca tribes, then later occupied by Pipils, before the Spanish conquered the area at the 16th century
